intro: Brachyscome salkiniae, commonly known as the Kangaroo Island daisy, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, showy yellow flowers surrounded by white ray florets. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. It is an erect annual or biennial herb with hairy stems and narrow leaves. Brachyscome salkiniae is often found in heathland and open woodlands, where it thrives in full sun.
